ai.summary: A challenging 15.6 km circular hike in the High Peak area of the UK, featuring steady ascents, rocky terrain, and rewarding summit views from Lantern Pike.
ai.terrain_summary: Long, steady ascents with rocky, uneven trails; exposed ridges and some scrambles; loose gravel and wet patches possible; occasional boggy sections.
ai.safety_notes: This is a strenuous route with long climbs and uneven ground. Navigation can be challenging in poor visibility; carry a map and compass. Wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate clothing; conditions on exposed ridges can change quickly; stay away from cliff edges, and plan extra time for descent. Inform someone of your itinerary and consider a GPS device or offline maps.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
Map and compass or GPS device
Emergency space blanket or bivouac sack

seo.title: Lantern Pike Circular (Ethel) – 15.6 km Hard Hike in High Peak, UK
seo.meta_description: Experience Lantern Pike Circular (Ethel): a 15.6 km hard hike in the High Peak area of the UK. Rugged terrain, exposed ridges, and sweeping summit views.
